Welcome to Froggy’s documentation!¶

Main Module¶

class froggy.framework.Framework(app, settings=None)[source]¶

Froggy’s main class. On initialization it will load Froggy settings along with the Flask application object.

Parameters

  • app (Flask) – The Flask application object.

  • settings (dic, optional) – Froggy settings, defaults to None.

frogify(*route_args, **route_kwargs)[source]¶

Custom froggy decorator that wraps the flask route decorator plus froggy specific features, similar to @app.route from Flask.

Parameters

  • route_args – The URL rule as string

  • route_kwargs – the options to be forwarded to the underlying Rule object.

Raises

froggy.exceptions.BadRequest – Raises exception if a user is not authorized to access a target resource.

home()[source]¶

Renders Froggy’s landpage.

Returns

A static HTML page as a string.

Return type

str

response(data=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Creates a JSON response object built around a python dic.

Parameters

data (dic, optional) – Data to be parsed into a JSON response object, defaults to None.

Returns

JSON response object.

Return type

Response

Database Module¶

class froggy.database.Database(connection, target=None)[source]¶

The Database class represents a database of type froggy.database.Type.

dict_factory(cursor, row)[source]¶

Convert database results to a list of dictionaries.

class froggy.database.Query(connection, target=None)[source]¶

The Query class represents a query object to be executed on a froggy.database.Database object.

execute(statement, args=None)[source]¶

Execute an SQL Statement

Parameters

  • statement (str) – The SQL statement to be executed against the database.

  • args (list) – The list of arguments for the SQL statement.

Raises

BadRequest – Raises a database error if something goes wrong.

Returns

If the SQL statement is a SELECT then it returns a list of results; If the SQL statement is an INSERT then the id of the new entry is returned.

Return type

list or int

get_last_id(table, id_column)[source]¶

Gets the last id (primary key value) of a table. This id is usually sequencial.

Parameters

  • table (str) – Name of the table you wish to get the last entry id (primary key value).

  • id_column (str) – Name of the primary key column.

Raises

BadRequest – Raises a database error if something goes wrong.

Returns

An integer that represents the unique value that identifies a row of a table.

Return type

int

class froggy.database.Type[source]¶

Database ‘flavors’.

class Mysql[source]¶
class Sqlite3[source]¶

Authentication Module¶

class froggy.authentication.Authentication[source]¶

The main Authentication class. This class is parent of several sub authentication classes froggy.Authentication.JWTAuth.

check_password(db_hashed_psw, user_psw)[source]¶

Check if a hashed password (from a database) is equal to the one provided by a user.

Parameters

  • db_hashed_psw (bytes) – The hashed password.

  • user_psw (str) – The plaintext user inputted password.

Returns

True if both passwords are equal, false otherwise.

Return type

bool

hash_password(psw)[source]¶

Hash a password with some ‘salt’ using bcrypt

Parameters

psw (str) – The password to hash.

Returns

The hashed password that includes the ‘salt’.

Return type

str

class froggy.authentication.JWTAuth(JWT_SECRET_TOKEN, JWT_EXPIRATION_SECONDS)[source]¶

Authentication class based on JWT. The authentication and authorization implementations follows the workflow defined for JSON Web Tokens (JWT), see https://jwt.io/introduction for more details.

authenticate(user, email, db_psw, psw)[source]¶

Authenticates the user by comparing two hashed and dynamically salted passwords. The access token will be store on the provide user dic.

Parameters

  • user (dict) – The user is represented as a Python dictionary and it will be included in the authorization access token.

  • email (str) – User email.

  • db_psw (str) – Database password (salted and hashed).

  • psw (str) – Plaintext password inputted by the user.

Raises

froggy.exceptions.BadRequest – Exception on Authentication failure or User already Authenticated.

authorized(request)[source]¶

Check if the user is authenticated, authorized to access a service. The authorization procedure is accomplished by checking if the authorization token of the user is available on the database.

Parameters

request (Request object) – The request object.

Returns

Returns true if the user is authorized to access a resource, false otherwise.

Return type

bool

expired_or_invalid(token)[source]¶

Check if a token is still valid (expired?).

Parameters

token (str) – The authorization access token of the user.

Returns

True if the token is expired, false otherwise.

Return type

bool

get_auth_token(request)[source]¶

Retrieve the authorization token from the request header.

Parameters

request (Request object) – The current request object.

Raises

froggy.exceptions.BadRequest – When an authorization token was not provided.

Returns

Returns the authorization access token.

Return type

str

hop_out(request)[source]¶

Log out using the authorization access token provided by the user in the header of the request.

Parameters

request (Request Object) – The current request object.

Raises

froggy.exceptions.BadRequest – For database related errors.

Returns

Returns a json response object.

Return type

Response Object

in_group(request, allowed_groups)[source]¶

Check if user is in a group allowed to access the target resource.

Parameters

  • request (Request object) – The current request object.

  • allowed_groups (list) – The list of groups (IDs) that are allowed to access a target resource.

Returns

True if the user belongs to the set of groups allowed to access a target resource, false otherwise.

Return type

bool

Exceptions Handling Module¶

exception froggy.exceptions.BadRequest(**kwargs)[source]¶

BadRequest class, the name says it all.

froggy.exceptions.handle_bad_request(error)[source]¶

Catch BadRequest exception globally, serialize into JSON with the flask_json.json_response() helper function.

Parameters

error (dic) – A dictionary that should include the following key:value pairs: [status] - HTTP status codes (e.g., 403) [error] - A short description of the error [message] - A description of the error path - Service endpoint (use, request.path)

Returns

A Response object

Return type

Response

File Handling Module¶

class froggy.files.File(file, upload_directory, allowed_extensions=None)[source]¶

File class, the name says it all.

get(filename, as_attachment=False)[source]¶

Static method to get a file from a static folder available on the server.

Parameters

  • upload_directory (str) – The upload directory that must exist on the root of the project.

  • filename (str) – The name of the file to be removed.

  • as_attachment (bool, optional) – Set to true if you want to send this file with a Content-Disposition: attachment header, defaults to False.

Raises

BadRequest – Raises when the file is not found on the upload directory or there are permission-related errors.

Returns

Returns the file content.

Return type

Any

list()[source]¶

Get the list of files from a static folder available on the server.

Parameters

upload_directory ([type]) – [description]

remove(filename)[source]¶

Static method to remove a file from a static folder available on the server.

Parameters

  • upload_directory (str) – Target upload directory that must exist on the root of the project.

  • filename (str) – The name of the file to be removed.

Raises

BadRequest – Raises when the file is not found on the upload directory or there are permission-related errors.

upload()[source]¶

Uploads a file to a static folder available on the server.

Raises

  • BadRequest – Raises if the filename defines a subdirectory.

  • BadRequest – Raises if the type of the valid is not valid.

  • BadRequest – Raises if a invalid file is parsed.

Froggy’s Gadgets¶

froggy.gadgets.exists(test_subject, keys)[source]¶

Check if a list of keys exists in an object.

Parameters

  • test_subject (dic) – A dictionary object.

  • keys (list of str) – The list of keys to be checked against the ‘test_subject’.

Returns

True if the list of keys is available, false otherwise.

Return type

bool

froggy.gadgets.fprint(message, **kwargs)[source]¶

The worldly know froggy custom print function (not really!).

Parameters

  • message (str) – Message to display using the standard print function.

  • message – Options

froggy.gadgets.normpath(path)[source]¶

Function to normalize a path. Expand the os.path.normpath to wrap white-spaced words with apostrophes (e.g. /Google Drive -> /’Google Drive’).

Parameters

path (str) – Path to normalize.

Returns

Returns a normalized path

Return type

str
